Please add a test for this new API.

@markdroth I've added a new test `verify_peer_options.cc` which covers this API, including checking that the expected values get passed through and that the callback return value is respected. Let me know if you have any comments on it.

Thanks.  The test looks pretty good.  I have just a couple of minor comments.

---

Reviewed 8 of 8 files at r3.
Review status: all files reviewed at latest revision, all discussions resolved.

---

*[build.yaml, line 2756 at r3](https://reviewable.io/reviews/grpc/grpc/15274#-LC06sEV1JS3lmcv9wS9:-LC06sEV1JS3lmcv9wSA:btoflnm) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/898aca3868c947c19f7834f67b2be59b393b7e78/build.yaml#L2756)):*
> ```YAML
>   - linux
>   secure: true
> - name: handshake_verify_peer_options
> ```

Please also add this target to `test/core/handshake/BUILD`.

---

*[test/core/handshake/verify_peer_options.cc, line 203 at r3](https://reviewable.io/reviews/grpc/grpc/15274#-LC0RJM17nWzC3zpLYDI:-LC0RJM17nWzC3zpLYDJ:b-whfjfd) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/898aca3868c947c19f7834f67b2be59b393b7e78/test/core/handshake/verify_peer_options.cc#L203)):*
> ```cpp
>                            void* userdata) {
>   if (target_host != nullptr) {
>     GPR_ASSERT((callback_target_host = static_cast<char*>(
> ```

Can use `gpr_strdup()` here.

---

*[test/core/handshake/verify_peer_options.cc, line 208 at r3](https://reviewable.io/reviews/grpc/grpc/15274#-LC0RLWM-XcWpVQtc6GW:-LC0RLWM-XcWpVQtc6GX:brhumzt) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/898aca3868c947c19f7834f67b2be59b393b7e78/test/core/handshake/verify_peer_options.cc#L208)):*
> ```cpp
>   }
>   if (target_pem != nullptr) {
>     GPR_ASSERT((callback_target_pem = static_cast<char*>(
> ```

Same here.

@JackOfMostTrades, it looks like there are a number of test failures here.  In particular, the new handshake_verify_peer_options test is failing in a number of places.  And it looks like you need to run tools/distrib/clang_tidy_code.sh and tools/distrib/clang_format_code.sh.  Can you please take a look?

There is also a node build failure, which looks to be related to the c-core API change being made here.  @nicolasnoble and/or @murgatroid99, can one of you please look at this?  Since the node code isn't in the main repo anymore, I don't know how to fix that.

We can't really do these updates in lockstep anymore - but we can prepare a PR in the grpc-node repo accordingly.

PSA: this also means you need to change the core's major version since it's an API breakage.

> PSA: this also means you need to change the core's major version since it's an API breakage.

I suppose I should ask: this change is an API breakage because it adds the `verify_peer_options` argument to `grpc_ssl_credentials_create`. That method already has a `void* reserved` final argument on it though. Is that reserved argument there for a reason or could we avoid API breakage by purposing that reserved argument for verify_peer_options?

> We can't really do these updates in lockstep anymore - but we can prepare a PR in the grpc-node repo accordingly.

First step would of course be to just add a NULL argument to comply with the new API, but FWIW I've got a PR ready to code to expose the verify callback all the way to node.

> It looks like there are a number of test failures here. In particular, the new handshake_verify_peer_options test is failing in a number of places. And it looks like you need to run tools/distrib/clang_tidy_code.sh and tools/distrib/clang_format_code.sh. Can you please take a look?

I'll run the tidy/format scripts again; I did that before but I must have messed something up in the squash. Not sure why the new test would be failing (it was certainly working locally); I'll try and dig into it later today. Are you able to provide any insight into the other failing tests? Entirely possible I missed some places that need to be updated with the API change (especially with all the rebasing), but that would be a compile-time error. I'm not sure where runtime errors would be coming from with this change.
